Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: sherrie526
Reviews.Content: The location is great, close to Earls Court tube station. Room was very small. Price seemed high. Breakfast was minimal.

Reviews.Title: “worse hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: pegstar b
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel and was told we couldnt get into our room because housekeeper were still cleaning the rooms at 2pm which is suppose to be check-in time.very dissapointed, the girl at the reception, Italian girl was rude and not friendly and she couldnt speak english properly. i dont usually complain about were i stay but this was my worse experience. the room was discusting, too small for too people, breakfast is disgusting. i woudnt recommend this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room pity about the staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kaz1971_11
Reviews.Content: We arrived on an early flight and was told there was no chance of getting into our room early but were allowed to leave our bags in. When we were given the key to our room we were then sent to the 3rd floor. When we got there we couldn't find our room, we had to go down 2 flights up half a flight across a landing down another 1/2 flight then eventually up another flight until we got to our room!!! This was all unexplained by receptionist!! When we eventually got to the room we were pleasantly surprised. The room was brand new and looked like we were the 1st to stay in it. It was crisp clean and modern. Only when we got into bed did we realise it was 2 unsecured single beds. The sheet didn't fit the 2 beds and a king size quilt was on side ways so didn't the bed properly. Whilst we were having a nap, there was a knock on the door which my husband answered, it was the manager, he wanted to check something in the bathroom, my husband said that I was asleep but manager said it would only take a minute, the manager said he needed to check do hubby felt pressured to leg him in. He'd went to bathroom switched light on and off then left!!! I was v annoyed and embarrassed particularly as I was still in bed!!! The bathroom was v well equipped with excellent power shower, only down side was it had a towel rail which u were unable to switch off which left the room v warm. Room also did not have a telephone. Next morning for breakfast we arrived about 9.20am ( breakfast available until 9.30). When we walked in I said hello to staff member and asked did we just seat ourselves. She just looked at me then walked away!! We seated ourselves then proceeded with breakfast. At about 9.35am a workman entered the breakfast room and a couple of minutes later he asked us to finish off our breakfast as staff wanted to clear up!!! He said again 5 mins later!! So in the end we just had to up and leave our unfinished breakfast. In all the years visiting hotels I have never been asked to leave half way through our meals!!! Over all we enjoyed our stay but our main gripe was the staff. A lot of we had dealings with did not have good English which is hard for communication purposes!! Staff were grumpy and rude ( all except the receptionist on the 2 nd day). We would return but only if staff had customer service training and understand they are in the hospitality industry!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Poor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ela03
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at City Continental admittedly we got a really good deal through Superbreak including Rail and Accommodation so we did not have high exceptions of hotel. However we did not expect to get locked out of hotel on our first day at 6pm! We spent 10 mins trying to get back into the hotel buzzer on door did not work and girl at desk seemed to be oblivious until we continually banged on door! We stayed in a room that was still to be refurbished. Room and bathroom were clean but small, bed is a double but as one side is against the wall made it very small for 2 people also rubber sheets on bed which made bed uncomfortable. On arrival heater was on full we had no way to turn heating off we complained to reception who gave us a remote to control heating. We also had an old heater in room that the plug was melted into wall which left us with only one socket in room. There was no ventilation in bathroom and no window that could be opened in bedroom, this made room very warm and stuffy even with no heating on. There was lack of storage space in room but this would be due to room being small there was one open wardrobe with 4 coat hangers there were no drawers not enough storage for those on a short break we didn't even unpack! There is however a digital security box in room. Breakfast was good for a continental breakfast. Range of yoghurt, fruit, cereal, breads, croissants, cheese and boiled eggs. Range of fruit juices and a good coffee machine. Breakfast area could be busy especially around food area not much room at all. On the whole we didn't expect much from hotel the main reason we booked was for location which was excellent. Hotel is around corner from Earls Court Tube and is a great base for exploring London if your willing to stay in basic accommodation. There is a vast range of restaurants, fast food, pubs and shops near hotel. The hotel is in the midst of being refurbished this didn't have an impact on our stay but hopefully means hotel will be of a higher standard in the future.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't enjoy my stay here - only plus was location”
Reviews.Author: saritamar
Reviews.Content: + The only plus as I said - the location. It's just a couple of minutes from Earl's Court tube station * - This hotel is average at best. It/s very calstrophobic. The elevator, the single room, the double room, the staircase all felt terribly small and closing in. - Wifi costs 2GBP, that's a lot. It didn't work for me and I called reception and told them to cancel it right as I figured out it doesn't work, they agreed. On checkout they "forgot" they agreed and still wanted to charge me for it. - This was a business trip, and I had to sleep in a single room and then a double room with a colleague. I switched three rooms in less than a week - although we asked for it, they refused to let us stay in the same double room!!! That biggest trouble with that was that.. - The elevator doesn't reach 4th floor, so we had to carry our heavy bags in the steep, spiral and crackling staircase from 3rd floor to the 4th - hotel staff didn't offer any help. It was quite scary. * During my stay, the elevators at Earl's Court tube station didn't work, so I had to carry my heavy luggage for 3 floors of the station. This was a heavy lifting trip, if you consider the no elevator thing in the hotel. I came home bruised and hurting. If this could be a problem for you, check this issue beforehand.

Reviews.Title: “Building work”
Reviews.Author: beverley t
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed in the City Continental hotel a week before christmas and were greeted by workmen pulling up floor tiles in then reception and the dust was awful, we decided not to let first impressions put us off, so went to our room, which was very clean, apart from the dust which we could constantly taste, myself being an asthma suffer, was short of breath all through the night, my friend who had never suffered any breathing problems was too suffering from the taste of the dust, I think this hotel should have been shut down, whilst renovating was taking place, it is a health hazzard, it would not pass health and safety. In the morning I complained to the receptionist who just walked off, after giving me a bit of scrap paper to write on.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here until renovations are complete”
Reviews.Author: scotlandMrg
Reviews.Content: This 3* hotel was booked for us through Superbreaks as part of three-night trip to London. We checked in around 3pm, planning to spend the rest of the afternoon exploring Kensington. Although I did not expect it to be luxurious, I did expect the rooms to be clean. In all I was shown 6 rooms - all of which looked grubby and smelt unpleasant. When I contacted my travel agent I was told that I would require to pay Â£109 to move that afternoon. As I was unwilling to pay this I chose the best of the rooms I had been shown - although the carpet had stains on it which looked like they might have been cleaned- up vomit! In the morning we accessed the dining room by going out the front door - in the rain - and down through builders' materials to the basement, all guests trailing in cement and mud, and of course getting their trouser hems and footwear stained in the process. The only good points were that the receptionist was a very pleasant girl and the breakfast was what was expected of a 3* hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice staff, bad everything else!”
Reviews.Author: Beauborg
Reviews.Content: If you're paying less than about Â£35 per night, you might be happy with this hotel. Anything more, especially much more, and you'll be very disappointed. The room I stayed in was tiny; the bathroom particularly so: the toilet seemed wedged between the sink and the wall - unless you're particularly thin, you'll want to 'go' somewhere else! The staff were pleasant and it's in a good spot - very near the underground station and Earl's Court. But it's still not worth the money. Perhaps this hotel would appeal to the young backpacker type - but definitely not to business people.

Reviews.Title: “city continental london kensington”
Reviews.Author: vinaysanglikar
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very conveniently located in the heart of the city with all the amenities like tube station, pharmacy, restaurants and even laundry shop at a stone's throw distance from the hotel.Staff is very polite and cooperative and Laura and Gauri at the reception made our 4-day stay very comfortable.Even breakfast was good and the staff very attentive. On the negative side are the rooms which are very small by any standards. There is hardly any other staff to help you.No room service.If youcan put up with the inconveniences,a good plce to stay. Vinay Sanglikar

Reviews.Title: “location a plus but i would walk miles to avoid it”
Reviews.Author: c w
Reviews.Content: I wouldnt recomend this place, lots other options available on the same street that the rooms do not smell fusty and have a TV that you can see, plus walking around the room is always a plus!! Checking in was not a option early even though rooms already ready, (1.45pm i came) and the most appaling thing...Â£25-00 for 24 hours internet...thats over a pound a hour!! Avoid at all costs!!

Reviews.Title: “Choose another one”
Reviews.Author: MakeK
Reviews.Content: Just stayed in this hotel for two nights and cannot recommend to anyone, neighbourhood is nice though. We got a room from the lower ground floor (=basement) which was notably under some renovation. The room was freezing cold as for some reason the heating systems didn't work at all. We complaint about it several times and asked for portable heaters or extra blankets but except smiling understandingly the staff didn't do anything for it. Some of them actually said that they know that he basement is too cold to be used for acommodation ? The location is good (close to underground station), but as the train network in London is so wide-ranging nowadays, that goes for almost every hotel in the central London and in neighbouring areas. The only reason why this hotel basically gets any visitors is the huge lack of capacity of accommodation in London.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, tiny room, OK price by London standards”
Reviews.Author: BetteSpark
Reviews.Content: I was coming to London, pretty last-minute, during what I knew was still peak tourist season (a very sunny and warm October, Frieze Week in London too, on top of everything else), so I was ready to sacrifice comfort and elegance for the sake of two factors: price and location. This hotel satisfied both sets of criteria: 1) it was a one-minute walk from the tube station Earl's Court (on the District and Piccadilli lines), surrounded by supermarkets (M&S, Tesco) and nice pubs (*tip to avoid the horrid, sad breakfast in the hotel) 2) it cost me under 400 Pounds for 4 nights (including the w/e) which is pretty great, for London (makes me want to cry though, on the inside, when I compare that to other amazing European cities and the qualities of their hotels) I was travelling alone, so I got a tiny single room. When I say tiny, I mean: TINY. There's a single bed, and a closet/safe/tv tower of objects all stacked on top of one another, there's a bed-side table with a lamp, there's a little desk with a kettle and tea bags/coffee (thank God they had this; I preferred this to breakfast downstairs on a couple of the mornings) .. the shower was in a separate room with the toilet. Both were very clean, working very well, good water pressure, hot water available (though never between 8-9am). The bed was comfortable ... I slept very well all 4 nights. I see other people mentioned plastic sheets, cold/hot rooms, dirty sheets ... I didn't have any of these problems. It was all a very triste sight, but I had prepared myself for it mentally. Check-out is at 11am in the hotel, but you can keep your luggage there past that time, until you have your flight/train ... which is a nice touch. Breakfast was just sad ... I only went once. Sat next to a nice couple from Switzerland, chatted with them. The real problem, I guess, is not even so much the food (which sucks) but the fact that the 'dining area' is in the BASEMENT, so there's no light, and they need to open the door to get some light/air in there (=COLD, on an October morning), and there's another door in there, wide open, that looks like some rotting hobbit-cave, full of linens, towels, shovels, etc ... basically, stuff I don't necessarily want to see when I'm having breakfast. Food there: 2 types of toast, tea, coffee, peeled oranges (?), croissants (I never eat them anyway, but they looked foul), jam, butter, cheese, hard-boiled egg ... The staff: cleaning staff were all very friendly and smiley and polite. Though they sure don't let you sleep past 8.30am in this place! The front-desk staff: the chap who was there (don't remember his name) was friendly and kind, but was utterly useless at his job: he couldn't point out Trafalgar Square or Westminster on a map for me, couldn't tell me how to get to Piccadili Circus either ... but the girl (Martina, I think? She's Italian) was SUPER helpful, very nice, and very efficient. Conclusion: The breakfast services, the room and hotel are quite shabby, really, but - as other people said before: if your thoughts are SIGHTSEEING and BUDGET (sleep being a secondary factor!) then go for it: very easy to get to by public transport, nice neighbourhood, and OK price (for London).

Reviews.Title: “Basic, small but cheap and with great location.”
Reviews.Author: koko1978
Reviews.Content: In an expensive city like London, if you find a hotel with good location that is cheaper than most of the rest you search, of course you cant expect too much. With than idea in our minds, we spend our 7 days in this hotel. The location is great, just 2 minutes away from Earl Court station. Besides this area has many places to eat, including a Mark and Spencer, and a couple of pubs. From this station to Westminster you arrive in less than 10 minutes with the tube. The hotel from the outside itÂ´s not bad, the street in fact is quite nice and apparently quiet, although since there are many hotels in this street, it turns to be somehow noisy during the night while many tourists come back at night yelling so you have to get used to it. Most of the staff is really helpful, specially Adrien and the Italian girl. On the bad sideâ€¦..the room is extremely small and does not have any room to leave the clothes. The carpet and the walls are really old and the general aspect is not nice at all. We really had a hard time organizing where to put our baggage without blocking the room. We finally were able to do it but it was still pretty uncomfortable. On the positive side, the bed was comfortable and the shower was absolutely great. The breakfast is very basic, itÂ´s continental and for a toast, coffee and juice is ok but the croissants are really bad with no taste at all. All in all, I donÂ´t regret the choice since I was in a budget, itÂ´s not a bad choice if you plan to be outside all day long and just come back to take a shower and sleep. This is a hotel were you canÂ´t go and spend some time chilling out since there is no space for anything. So, if you chose just bear in mind this fact, and the most important one, you are paying less than most hotel located so near a tube and in a nice neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “terrible accommodation”
Reviews.Author: shelley370
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights recently and was very disappointed with the room. The air conditioner did not work for more than 3 minutes and as there was no remote had to get on the bed to start it up. The bed was on a slant which mean that I had to sleep sideways and even turned the mattress over but the room was sinking to the right. The bathroom was o'kay but would definitely never stay there again for the value is was terrible. Also after arriving home I noted that the day after I left there my credit card was used inappropriately to purchase glasses online.

Reviews.Title: “What a relief!”
Reviews.Author: innej
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently. Having read all the negative comments was almost afraid to open the room door. Noticed on arrival they had 4 "scores on the doors" which was a good sign. Hotel is old but is NOT dirty. Room was small but was thoroughly cleaned every day and bathroom was spotless with a great shower. Our only criticism was that we did not have any windows only a door leading onto a balcony. Obviously for health and safety there was no key so had to keep air conditioning on all the time.Beds were good quality and NO rubber sheets! Breakfast was more than adequate and again the room was spotless. Staff were constantly replenishing the food and cleaning and clearing tablesust don't understand what people expect for their money. A really good value hotel in a super location.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel, good location, miserable reception staff”
Reviews.Author: dave s
Reviews.Content: Good location 2 mins away from Earls Court tube station so well placed, hotel itself was decent, clean, not over specified with amenities but for a short stay good enough for a short stay. Only thing that ticked me of was the person running reception didnt bother to greet my "good morning" and then grunted his way through the rest of the check out procedure......

Reviews.Title: “too expensive”
Reviews.Author: ocean-sunfish
Reviews.Content: We got a 2-bed room although we booked a double-bed. the room was in below the ground, dark and smelly as you can't open the windows. the "breakfast" was a joke. only 2 toasts could be toasted at the same time and the toaster is veeeery slow- so I had to wait about 15min for it. then there was one sort of corn flakes, one sort of marmalade and one sort of cheese- that's all. I wouldn't go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Had my credit card number stolen”
Reviews.Author: ROCGirl54
Reviews.Content: After researching here on trip advisor, we chose this hotel for it's convenience to the underground, central location, and the fact that we could book a triple room without going bankrupt. It's a typical European hotel in an old building, with small rooms. Breakfast included was a plus. BUT - as we paid cash for everything in our overnight stay in London, this was the only place my credit card was out of my wallet (which was still in my possession). The next day I had a call from my credit card company that an online purchase for a clothing company in Leeds was attempted, and a restaurant meal in London completed. When I spoke to the receptionist at the desk, she rudely informed me that there is always someone in the office, and my information could not have been taken. My thought then is that someone in the office used my information. Fortunately, I had a second card with me to use for the rest of our vacation. So, If you stay here - monitor your card!

Reviews.Title: “Very sub-standard”
Reviews.Author: payingcust0mer
Reviews.Content: I appreciate that the hotel is having extensive building work done at the moment but the hotel has a duty to warn its customers and alter the prices accordingly. The 1st room we were shown was tiny, barely enough room for us both to stand and we asked to move. We then moved to a larger, bleak, dirty room, I feel ashamed that this could be the first impression tourists get of London. To charge that much for such a sub-standard hotel was wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Good location is the only positive thing I can say”
Reviews.Author: carrizizi
Reviews.Content: Very small room. Bed was a 4ft bed so not really suitable for 2 people. I spent 7.5 hours perched on the edge so made sleep impossible. In all fairness to my husband he did offer to sleep on the floor!!! We did ask to change rooms on several occasions but this was declined. The receptionists were unhelpful and their attitude was complete indifference and one huffed quite a lot!!! I'm not just referring to our problem but 4 people complained while we were waiting for our friends to come down from their room. There is refurbishment going on so this doesn't help. Think they will have to do an amazing job on the whole hotel to bring it up to scratch and I can't see them making the rooms slightly bigger! The toilet didn't work properly...lucky if it flushed once an hour. There was black mould on the grouting in the shower so avoided that. They use the cheapest toilet paper you can buy so my advice is to take your own. Breakfast is a basic buffet....you can have cereal, fresh fruit, toast and cold, hard croissants. The orange juice and coffee were nice though. I have stayed in many hotels, both in the UK and abroad and this is the worst. I was very thankful we only had to stay one night otherwise I would have been booking into another hotel. Good luck if you book this hotel and hope you have a better experience than me.

Reviews.Title: “Good location very small room”
Reviews.Author: Uruguayans
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent next to underground station where two lines take you everywhere around. The room was very very small, but clean and people were nice.

Reviews.Title: “it's actually pretty good”
Reviews.Author: Janymontreal
Reviews.Content: I am a little surprised by all the negative reviews. After having read them, I admit I was a little nervous about going there. However, I have just returned and I have to state that I was quite happy with this hotel. Yes, it needs a bit of new paint but the single room I had was very clean and quite big and comfortable. I had requested through email to have a room on an upper floor, and I was happy that they respected that. They cleaned the room every day, the breakfast was decent with a good choice of items and the breakfast room was clean and comfortable. The staff was helpful when asked, and honestly, this hotel is fine and the location is fantastic. I would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: EddieGlasgow
Reviews.Content: I booked one night in this hotel through "lastminuet.com , booked a double room and cost me Â£132.60 . When the taxi driver droped me at the hotel he asked me how much I payed for the room when I told him he laughed !!! When I checked in the and asked for my double room was told they had none , my room was so small the single bed had a worbrobe at the end of the bed with the door removed as there would be no room to open the door.Small portable TV ontop of the wardrobe as nowhere else it could go. The decor was very old and shaby looked more like a homeless shelter than a Â£132.60 hotel room. Later that evening I asked for a pint glass with ice , I was told "there is a glass in your toilet use that "and we have no ice ! The glass in the toilet was very small the ones you usualy get for rinsing after brushing your teeth. This place makes Faulty Towers look like the Hilton ! dont book this hotel at any cost . Not even a bar to have a drink !!! The paper work I had printed from lastminuet.com only had a 0871 number (Calls cost 10p per minute plus network extras) so I waited till I got home to complane. Lastminuet.com said because I didnt complain at the time there was nothing they could do. After being charged that amount of money for this room the last thing I was going to do was give a money making phone racket more money ! If anyone books through this company complain straight away if you need help, I work away and stay in hotels around 3 night per week and will never book through lastminuet.com ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Will never come back again.”
Reviews.Author: cwwt
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have stayed. The service is very poor. The receptionists are not helpful at all. The facilities, including the carpet and towels, seem to be very dirty. The Internet service is very poor as well -- not cheap, not reliable, and with restrictions (the hours purchased can only be used within 72 hours). The only plus side of this hotel is it is close to the tube. However, there are plenty of hotels around the ares with such benefits as well. It just gives me the worst experience ever.

Reviews.Title: “good location, good staff”
Reviews.Author: valib22
Reviews.Content: We were quite pleased with the hotel. Nothing fancy but the position is very good, very safe place with shops restaurants, a couple of night shops and boots around the corner. The underground station is few meters away. Overall really nice

Reviews.Title: “Well Pleased”
Reviews.Author: ei8dqb
Reviews.Content: Went to London last weekend (May 28-30 2011) Found it hard to get a hotel at a good price. Chelsea Flower show and Champions Leauge Final on. Booked the City Continental Kensington. It was one of the only hotels I could find avalivle with a tube station near by. After booking I read several reviews on Trip advisor and not many were good, so expecting the worse,I headed off. I booked two rooms. The hotel is just round the corner fron the Earls Court Tube station. The room was small but clean and did the job fine. There is no bar but I knew that before going. (There are 4 bars with in a 2 minute walk and loads of shops. There was 4 hours free internet if you had a laptop but there was and internet cafe round the corner Â£1-00 per hour. Breakfast was Continenl but again I knew this when booking. All day tube ticket for Â£6-60 per day. Staff were very helpful and on check out (11am) you can leave your bags as long as you like. Verry Happy and wil use it again. Kieran Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Great for the money”
Reviews.Author: wendt85
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here our first night in London. I agree with Plymouthbomb below in that while there's nothing fancy about it and it's very no frills, it's a pleasant place to stay for the price. Our room was ready when we arrived in London at 10am, the bathroom had been updated and had plenty of space, the beds were comfortable enough, and the location can't be beat. We didn't try the TV, so I can't speak for the number of channels offered. The breakfast was good--nothing special but good and filling. We were on the back side so even with our window open for cool air, the room was fairly quiet. The only questionable thing were the lights. Not all of them worked in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for location”
Reviews.Author: Plymouthbomb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few weeks ago for one night and have to say it's a good little find. Yes it is a bit tired and frayed around the edges, it's not comparable to a 4 star hotel and it doesn't have 150 channels on the TV. But for the price we paid for a double room (Â£55) in what is a clean, friendly hotel only 30 seconds walk from Earls Court tube, you would be hard pressed to find better.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a cheap city break”
Reviews.Author: r482ty
Reviews.Content: Myself and my friend stayed at this hotel while we were in London for a girlie couple of days. The price was great, the location couldnt be better and the staff were very helpful. However, the room was very small, the TV only had 3 working channels and the bathroom was more than cramped. While the bed was comfortable it and would not be long enough for anybody over about 5'5. There is no refridgerator in the room so you cannot bring any left over food home from restaurants that will go bad.

Reviews.Title: “Let this hotel be your last choice”
Reviews.Author: Tbezzy
Reviews.Content: This hotel has no cable. There were only 5 stations. It is in a good location of restaurants and the subway. The location is not near downtown but you can take the subway to the main attractions. This hotel is near the National Science Museum and the National History Museum. The hotel has four floors but the elevator only goes to the third floor. A double room means a double bed and not two beds. You have make sure you book the room that is conducive for your travel. I never was told where the breakfast was but i smelled the burned toast in the mornings. This hotel makes you buy wifi. WiFi is not free no matter what the hotel description says. I don't think they change they sheets when they clean the room during the stay so check your sheets. The shower water is not always hot. I would just say choose another hotel. The staff is not very friendly. The first room I was given was moldy and the lady at the front desk was acting like she never had that complaint before. I know mold when i see and smell it!! So she put me on the 4th floor. Go figure.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value: Clean, safe and great location for an amazing price”
Reviews.Author: BradshawEastMidlands
Reviews.Content: I was quite worried after reading other reviews that I'd made a mistake in booking here, but it was everything we were looking for, the double room was spacious and nicely decorated and the bathroom was very clean, large and modern too. I could see what people meant about the corridors looking a little tatty and the walls being thin but neither of those things disturbed us at all for Â£53 a night! Such a fantastic deal, especially with the location, it was everything we needed for a one night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the price and location”
Reviews.Author: MrMacIreland
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on this hotel I had no idea what to expect so my expectations were very low. I was pleasantly surprised. Location of the hotel was perfect and the hotel itself was fine. Room was spotless, tv, tea & coffee maker, safe - you don't really need much more when just sight seeing and using the room for sleep. Breakfast was fine and the hotel staff were very pleasant. Got 2 great nights sleep - no noise disturbance despite the fact that the majority of residents were under 21!! The hotel was a bit shabby and really needs to be done up but for the price it was ideal. Would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Terrible!”
Reviews.Author: nominalcircle
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location and the building looks OK from the front, but that's where the good points stop! The hallway to my room was very rundown and it smelt of burnt cooking oil. The room itself smelled of some foul industrial cleaning product, the carpets were very stained and the decor was so cheaply done. I was asked to pay 25 pounds for wireless broadband that didn't work (I didn't get charged for it ).It felt like cheap student accommodation, nothing like a hotel. I can honestly say, this this the worst hotel I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “awful”
Reviews.Author: ameoba100
Reviews.Content: i was meant to stay 3 nights but when i arrived i found hairs in my bed and the room was not clean. I had been kept up all night with parties going on either side of my room and banging on my wall all night, i rang recpetion who could not care less and said he was too busy to move my room and told me to ring back when he had finished his shift so he didnt have to deal with it! I was going to find another hotel that night but was too late so left first thing in the morning, room also felt like a sauna. I didnt feel safe in my room all night as i was female staying alone and up in London for business. Very disgusted, do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money with brilliant customer service”
Reviews.Author: casparov
Reviews.Content: As part of a stag do I was the only one in our party not to stay in the Easy Hotel. The facilities at this hotel are what you would expect,cheap tv, air con (didn't try it), cupboard, soap, shower gel etc, tea making facilities and a safe. The Easy hotel cost the same and didn't even have a cupboard, let alone any of the other facilities listed above at all, and you hand to pay Â£5 for a TV remote. So the City is onto a winner already. The reception staff were brilliant. On checking in the lady on the desk was very efficient and pleasant and we spoke breifly about the fact she came from Mumbai (she refered to london as 'quite calm'). On checking out there was a bit of a queue but the gentleman on the desk did make sure to address us all in the queue to say we'd be served as quickly as possible. And when I got to the front he apologised for the delay and manged very successfully to clear the back log by sorting out a few of us at a time. The rooms are what you'd expect from a London hotel at this price. Clean, small (but more floor space than Easy Hotel!), a little tired in places with DIY style patches here and there but totally acceptable and with a very good, and quite new looking shower. The floors creaked like a old man on a hot plate so in the morning any movement from the adjacent rooms could be clearly heard. No road noise that I was aware of though and no other sounds from the other rooms. I didn't get to try the breakfast as having a morning in bed without having to get up with the kids was worth missing it. Location - a 2 minute walk to Earls Court tube, perfect for what I needed. I would recomend it for people on a budget wanting a pleasant enough place to stay while in town on a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant short stay, first time in London”
Reviews.Author: xscotslassx
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I had been in London, as I was travelling myself I wanted a hotel close to the Olympia for an event on the Saturday! You are literally round the corner from the tube, which provides services on both the district line and pickidilly line, and you can be in central London within minutes! My room was on the top floor, and although booking a single room, I received a double room which was nice, despite it being the end of November and freezing temperatures the window was open upon entering the room, the room was a lovely size (especially for London) it had it's own safe and a few coat hangers, there was tea and coffee making facilities and a hair dryer. The bathroom was clean and tidy with fresh towels every day of my stay. The bed was very comfortable, but it was against the wall which may provided a problem for a couple in the room! Breakfast was ok, that's all I could really say, the breakfast room was in the basement, there was a selection of fruit juices available and tightest, I especially love croissants but I was disappointed that they weren't warm croissants. Overall I enjoyed my stay and would return again, although I did notice that the room rate was advertised at reception at Â£100 per night, no way would I pay this, I paid Â£134 for two nights which is exceptionally good value, if for nothing else but the location.

Reviews.Title: “I was pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Penfold22
Reviews.Content: After reading the previous review for October entitiled "do not stay here" I was very worried about this hotel which had been booked for my Grandaughter and myself for one night . We had a room at front of hotel the bedding, towels and bathroom were very clean and well supplied with toiletries and tea/coffee the decor was clean and modern (yes the carpet was stained in a coupleof places) the guy on reception was pleasant and the breakfast room clean with good variety of continental breakfast. The location was ideal and I would not hesitate to stay there again assuming, of course, that all bedrooms were of similar standard

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful. Never stay here.”
Reviews.Author: DrDaniels
Reviews.Content: We arrived after 9 so I could not leave to find another hotel. The place was dirty and very shabby. The corridors to our room were dirty and I was beginning to worry what the room was like. We opened the door to a grubby room with twin beds. The final straw was when I pulled back the duvet and discovered a stain that looked like dried sick. My sisters bed also had a stain that looked like blood. I went down to reception and asked them for some clean sheets. They were unable to provide any the receptionist had no key for the laundry cupboard. He said he would sort it out and bring some up. When it got to 12pm we realised he was not going to provide us with any sheets so I had to remove the bottom sheet and turn it over and put the dried sick at the bottom. I covered my pillow with some of my clothes as I did not want to put my skin next to the sheets. I did not want to shower in the morning as the shower was full of mould and the shower head not clean. I was also wary that the towels might not be clean. I did not sleep all night because it felt so discusting to be there. I shoud have left at nine and gone straight to another hotel. Please don't put yourself through this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. rooms could use an update”
Reviews.Author: Sarkybird
Reviews.Content: excellent location and friendly staff. the carpets and bedspreads can certainly use an update but the room was clean and comfortable. The only real drawback is the thin walls and creaky floorboards. This wouldn't have been a huge irritation but the people next door were screamers and banging on doors. The other drawback is that while there is wifi in the building you have to pay additional for it. Also, there was a communal computer mentioned on their website which doesn't actually exist. The continental breakfast left a lot to be desired but is pretty standard on what you get in similar hotels. All in all I'd stay here again. the location couldn't be better.

Reviews.Title: “Very avgerage”
Reviews.Author: CheshireSunlover
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at the City Continental over the August Bank Holiday with my husband Paul. Reception was pleasant and helpful. Corridors had dirty, stained carpets, walls were flaking and very tatty. Given basement room looking out on weed patch. Could not open French doors so no fresh air or escape route there. Minute room - had tea and coffee facilites but they were not replaced when used, nor the bin emptied, nor lavatory roll replaced. Cracked and broken bathroom tiles. Dirty carpet. Bed was comfortable and the bedding good. Breakfast was to say the least basic. Very close to Earls Court station. London itself was just wonderful, as always.

Reviews.Title: “Good sleep, clean room and shower”
Reviews.Author: fidelio82
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in April, for 3 nights. The room I was staying at was at the back side of the building, looking towards the garden. so it was quiet, I could hear the birds singing. The single room was quite small, with a standard single bed, but everything was clean. The shower was good too. There was a small TV with only 5 channels available, but the picture quality was good. I enjoyed my stay, I paid around Â£60 per night, which is not too bad for booking it only 10 days advance. The staff was helpful and smiling. The breakfast was continental, so don't expect much, just a regular breakfast. The breakfast area is quite big, you don't have a problem with finding an available table. I must also add that the wifi internet connection speed was very good (I could download at a speed of 300kb per sec.) and as far as i can remember the first 24 hrs of usage was free, which was more than enough for my 3-day stay. I enjoyed my stay, and will suggest it to friends who need a budget hotel in London.

Reviews.Title: “Small but nice!”
Reviews.Author: fferraz
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel for those who'll spend all day outside. The room was very VERY small, but served its purpose for me since I was alone and only looking for somewhere to shower/sleep. The room was very clean, the bed sheets were decent, the shower was hot, everything as it should be. Included breakfast was very nice too, for the price you pay. Toasts, yougurt, eggs, croissant, hot chocolate, coffee, etc... Very nice place too, so you stay right beside the Earl's Court Tube Station.

Reviews.Title: “An experience you should avoid”
Reviews.Author: AssasinsGreed
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is situated in a convenient location just next to Earls Court tube station in London and also just a 5 minute walk from the main exhibition center. The outside view of the Hotel (and street in general) looks quite nice, but that's where all the positive points end. Hotel staff are not necessarily rude, they are just not very welcoming or friendly. When asking them a question they have a sort of 'Oh god not you again' sort of vibe going on. I have to say, knowing that the hotel was situated in Kensington (One of the high class areas of London) I automatically assumed that there would be nothing to worry about. The saying; "Never assume or you will make an [--] of you and me", has never been so true!! Upon arriving at the hotel in a taxi, just getting out, behind me on the opposite side of the street there was some drunken louts being their usual loutish selves and about to start a fight with some other students who were situated opposite (in London Electronics College) but I must say this fight didn't kick off. During the late hours of the evening say 10pm - 2am it wont be uncommon to hear drunken arguments spewing out from the street below you, however no need to worry as this is very common everywhere throughout the UK. Walking in the hotel lobby and trying to check in to my room didn't take very long however the guy behind the desk wasn't very welcoming, didn't smile once and at no point did he leave me with the impression that in the event of me needing something would he offer assistance. This was the general impression I got from all of the hotel staff behind the desk in the lobby. Not particularly rude, just not welcoming, not very helpful and they never seem to smile. Take my advice and don't book your room to include breakfast as well as you will basically be throwing your money down the drain. They advertise their breakfast as being 'Continental' which basically is a nice way of them saying that if you are looking for a hot/cooked breakfast you wont find it here. They offer very basic, toast and cereal. Its worth going out on to the high-street as there is a large variety of cafe's, restaurants, sandwich bars and pubs to eat at, as well as all the usual fast food outlets. They also have a Marks & Spencer's simply food supermarket just at the top of the road where you can buy lots of nice things at a reasonable and cheap price. The hotels carpets inside the rooms and also out on the landings look.... how can I put it.... not new, nor do they look very clean. Blotches and stains on the carpeting here and there, is not uncommon. They have wooden floor boards with carpeting plastered on top, I'm sure the floor boards are the same as when the hotel building was first erected and they tend creak and make noise any time you are walking or standing on top. The floor boards are destroyed and or cracked underneath. Now let me get to the part about the room.... Anybody wishing to relive their university days will feel at home, as the rooms and lobby in general give a strong feel of University/College dormitories. The fittings and furniture inside are very similar to what you would expect to find in a dormitory. Basically as you enter the room there is a narrow corridor with the toilet/bathroom on the left hand side. The tiles on the bathroom floor looked very shabby, with dirt in the grooves, and stains in the corner. The toilet itself (I'll let that be a surprise for you, let me just say don't expect it to be anything good). The shower, to give you an idea of what my impression of the shower was let me just tell you this... when taking a shower I would wear flip flops and keep the curtains opened as I wouldn't want anything touching me. Also something I regretted was not taking any of my own towels, so if you have the opportunity take some towels with you, you should. The bed was comfortable and the sheets on it looked fairly clean, and were changed daily. The blanket they put on top of the duvet, the moment I got into the room I peeled it off to find a small red stain on the inside, so I just unrolled the whole thing and left it on the floor. I didn't actually sleep in the bed, I slept on top, not even using the duvet... just used the four wafer thin pillows they provide you to sort of make up my own cover/blanket. The cupboard in my room didn't have a door on it, the small box like TV was placed on top, thank god I took my laptop with me! Plus TV has channels 1 - 4 no satellite here. Wireless Internet costs quite a lot, 24 hours costs Â£25 they also give you the option of 2 hours and 4 hours but cant remember what the costs were. Best thing to go for is the 24 hours if you are staying for a few days. Cleaners tend to knock on and enter your room everyday at about 11am whether you have the do not disturb sign outside or not. Every room has a small safe inside, my advice put all money, credit cards and travel documents including passport in there. I'm not saying the cleaners will steal your stuff, but I caught one of the cleaners (brunette small tattoo on neck) coming into my room on two separate occasions when I knew the room had already been cleaned, she said she didn't finish the bathroom. If it happened once id believe her but as it happened twice she probably had the impression that shed be playing supermarket sweep in my room (should re-title it to room sweep). As the rooms don't have any mini fridges inside the only option you have for keeping your groceries cold is to take ice from the machine downstairs and create your own little fridge with a plastic bag full of ice. Only problem is the ice machine downstairs although it provides ice (free of charge) there is no scoop to scoop the ice nor is there an ice bucket to store the ice. When I asked the guy at the lobby how am I expected to take and store the ice from the machine, his response was.... Er not sure..... maybe try putting it in your glass (cocky response) to which I replied, well if it wasn't the size of an egg cup I might have considered it. Lastly they did order me a taxi on my last day there, I also asked for a wake up call which is basically like a missed call they give you, so if you are a heavy sleeper don't even bother asking for one. The taxi was a fixed price of Â£45 to London Heathrow airport.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good choice”
Reviews.Author: Tomto147
Reviews.Content: Maybe for that price you can not expect more but still there is a need for a good temperature in your room during winter. The hotel is trying to save money so there is no heating. They turn it on only every morning, but during the day and most of the night it is off!. The room was very small even as for London standards. Cleanliness was OK. Don't go for the room in the basement. It is dark and gloomy. The stuff at reception is rather poor. The only advantage of this hotel is location - close to Earls Court Exhibition Center. Now I know there are better choices around...

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the Tin!!! and at a Good Price!!!”
Reviews.Author: Expert123
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights while attending an interview in London. The genetlman that checked me in was very pleasant and helpful, once checked in i needed an iron and ironing board of which he produced from reception straight away thank goodness as i needed to iron my clothes for my interview. The room was a single room, to be fair it was a small room but for Â£35 per night i was not expecting the Hilton. The room was clean with all facilties, tea/coffee, tv and remote, clean linen. The bathroom was very clean with soaps and shampoos available Breakfast was a conteintal, done the job! The restaurant area was very clean! BIG PLUS POINT - the hotel is 2 minutes walk away from Earls Court Tube Station, come out of the station turn right and take the next right on the first street, the hotel is on the left hand side This is not the Ritz so if you want a cheap stay then stay here, but do not expect to stay for cheap and expect the Ritz service and leave bad comments on here its not fair on the BUDGET hotel

Reviews.Title: “don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: deneven
Reviews.Content: was looking for a hotel for this year and this hotel came up. we stayed here last year for 2 nights, we was given a double room in the basement and went out for the day to come back and someone had tried to break into our room, the glass door was totally shattered as there was a glass door leading to the outside, we went straight to reception the staff could not speak good english, we asked to be moved to another room and was told there was no other room available, we insisted that the door be repaired , we was told they did not have a manager on site until monday (this was saturday) and they had no repair person on site, we was told we would have stay in the room or take a single room, obviously we was not going to stay in the room as we was not safe nor was our things.we would not have been able to leave the room I asked if we would get a refund as we have had to take a single room yet paid for a double as it was not our fault they should have someone on site at least who could do any repairs required, i was told to put it in writing before i left which i did the single room was a cupboard and my husband is 17stone so we both had to sleep sat up across the bed all night since leaving the letter at the desk on leaving and ringing 4 times to speak to a manager only to be told he would ring me back and have sent numerious emails. and surprise surprise we have never had any reply to my letter, calls or emails a truely rude, disgraseful, dirty hotel that i will never stay in ever again, a carboard box would have been better than this hotel , there was no customer service at all, on leaving we was laughed at by the receptionist because we had to sit up all night, unfortunately we was not laughing but they were all the way to the bank such a rip off hotel

Reviews.Title: “Don't get a room in the basement.. :-/”
Reviews.Author: Tikkeni
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pretty good for the money. Staff not all that friendly. Location, good, easy to get to and from from the center. In nice neighbourhood. Free breakfast is reeeeealy not good, nothing fresh about it, canned fruit, dry bread, ect. But hey, its free. We had a basment room, and it was sooo damp and mouldy, my astma was acting up. We werent able to open any of the windows, it was really claustrofobic.. :-/ After one nights "sleep" in that room I could hardly breathe.. :-/ If you'd be so lucky, NOT to get a room in the basement, maybe your time there will be better.. :)

Reviews.Title: “A good value for a great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: amcastle2410
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel becuase it was the cheapest place in the area we wanted to stay in. The rooms were tiny, but they did have air condition.The staff was friendly, and they provided luggage check prior to checkoput. My only complaint was that we had a basement room with no view and an awkward step down that made lugging international luggage around. difficult The Continental breakfast was really good for a freebie. It was just your typical free hotel breakfast items.However, the coffee machine was awesome. Nothing better than a decent free espresso/latte/hot chocolate/ect in the morning. Also, The location could not be better. There is an undergound station just around the corner, plenty of eating and shopping, and within walking to distance to many well known tourist sites. I would definitely reccomend this place to others, and stay there again (requesting a non-basement room).

Reviews.Title: “Extremely low quality, rude staff”
Reviews.Author: mmrLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not even close to what's on the photo.The lobby is quite shabby and worn-out. Staff was very rude and indifferent to my needs.Ask to see the room first,do not pay in advance. I got into an argument, I demanded my money back after I saw my room,the manager on duty refused to reimburse me,only when I threatened to call police did they offer a room that was a notch better and had a small balcony. I wouldn't give this hotel more than one star. The only advantage was its proximity to the tube station. The free wifi service advertised on their web site is slow and almost impossible to use. Do not stay there if you have other options.

Reviews.Title: “Poor condition and rude personnel”
Reviews.Author: AP-PA-GR
Reviews.Content: There was mildew smell in the room. My sister's allergy got triggered. The sink and the bath tub were clogged. The shower was covered with rust. The personnel at the reception was unfriendly and uncooperative. The carpet in the reception area was filthy.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel if you get a good rate, single rooms are tiny.”
Reviews.Author: KateE006
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in Earl's Court - not Kensington as name suggests. However the location is pretty good - very short walk to Earl's Court tube (3 lines) and lots of amenities in the area (including internet). Hotel claims to be 3 star but is more like a 2 star with a few extras thrown in (eg tea/coffee facility in room) - let down by the miniscule size of single rooms (doubles may be ok). If you are tall/large you will have issues with the bathroom in the single! Room does have in room safe, TV, airconditioning (altho mine didn't have a remote). Breakfast (included) is a basic continental. Hotel does have a lift and staff were very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “good times in the city”
Reviews.Author: rainbowbazooka
Reviews.Content: I switched to this hotel after a rough experience elsewhere and was very pleased. The hotel is extremely close to earl's court tube station, and thus also close to many services and places to eat. The room was a good size complete with a comfortable bed, a painting on the wall, a tv showing 5 channels, a safe, and a kettle with tea bags and sugar. The bathroom was quite small, but was also very clean and the shower was warm and had good water pressure. All in all, I found the staff to be quite friendly, the hotel and area quite safe, and the room to be clean and comfortable. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very small, but clean and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: VonnieSouthAfrica
Reviews.Content: The room was very, very small, even by London standards. Ran the risk of burning myself against the heater when moving around the room and even had to sit sideways on the toilet. Not a variety of TV channels. Breakfast average. Hotel well situated, close to subway, supermarket, all amenities and a great Indian cuisine restaurant closeby. Will stay again, but only for short periods.

Reviews.Title: “okay, but you get what you pay for....”
Reviews.Author: Jenf12345
Reviews.Content: You definitely get what you pay for in London, so at 48 euros a night, i didn't have very high expectations! the hotel is not really in kensington but in earl court, south of kensington, pretty far southwest of the city but easily accessible by train and just a 5-10 minute walk from kensington (shopping, gardens, palace, etc). The single room was really tiny but clean, just enough space for a small bed and barely room for the luggage. On the positive side, it was pretty clean, with air conditioned rooms (it was one of the hottest days in london when i stayed) and standard amenities like a hairdryer. the breakfast was very basic but sufficient, and 1st day of wifi was free. All in all, a good value for the price, but only if you don't plan to spend much time in your room!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel at convenient location”
Reviews.Author: P_and_T_Wales
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 1 night in a double room. The hotel is very conveniently located, just a minute or two from South Kensington station,and quiet apart from the inevitable Heathrow jets. My room on the lower ground floor was of adequate size - not large but not poky either â€“ and very clean. It had all the essentials including a desk and,surprisingly, air conditioning and a safe. However, the lack of any opening windows left the room with a musty smell. On arrival I found the loo outlet was blocked (though the loo was clean) and the safe not responding, but the staff were very courteous and helpful and rectified both problems within minutes. The electrically heated shower was fine and spacious,but I struggled to get hot water in the sink. The Continental breakfast was pretty basic. Bearing in mind that the hotel is only 2* and is cheap by central London standards, it's decent value for money. However, next time I would probably grit my teeth and spend more for a slightly higher standard.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap enough but nothing more”
Reviews.Author: fedmarci
Reviews.Content: The personnel is pretty much incompetent, a lot of them speak a basic english and don't know how to perform their job. Encountered extreme rudeness at the check in (problems with the credit card) and during breakfast (they started bringing food away while I was still picking from it). The rooms are very small but clean. Ridiculous thing, the aircon in my room was broken, so they had put there a portable aircon, which was filthy, made a terrible noise and because of this they had to lock the windows on a half open/half closed position. Also, it took a lot of space so I couldn't walk to my bedside but had to jump on from the other side. Can't understand why they didn't give me another room, since there was plenty of availability. The tube is just around the corner so it's very convenient. Also a couple of shops, restaurants and a pub in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Handy location to Earls Court Tube Station”
Reviews.Author: izzy1717
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very close to the Earls Court Tube Station, lots of eating places also very handy. Thr room was quite small but adequate for the time we were there. The location of our room meant it was very quiet.. Good breakfast provided.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Uncle_Spike
Reviews.Content: City Continental is a short walk to the Earl's Court Tube Station and that is extremely convenient. The neighborhood has restaurants, drug stores, small groceries, banks, and music venues nearby. We like a convenient location with useful amenities. The hotel itself was fine. This is a no-frills hotel. It is a fine place to sleep and get organized for the day's activities. We came to see London, not the inside of a hotel. The hotel did not get in our way. The rooms were very small but that is typical; the morning breakfast was fruit, bread products of many types, yogurt, juices, hard-boiled eggs. And good morning service. Nothing at all fancy mind you. The price was quite reasonable. The ad said free internet - that was true only for the first three days and then we paid - still a good deal - and we found it extremely useful to have the internet for planning. The telephone charged a minimal price for calls - we just made short calls to venues. I never expect much from a shower in a place like this but it had a good one. We had no noise problems and we saw no rodents/pests.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at a great price.”
Reviews.Author: kraor
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at this hotel.I was pleasantly surprised how close to the "Earls Court Station" in order to easily catch the "Piccadilly Line" to Heathrow.I was in transit from Gatwick so had to overnight in London to catch my flight the next day.Receptionist was very courteous & polite. They even tried to help me download my online boarding passes.The breakfast was fine it came with the rates in which it consisted of fruit,cereal,eggs,juice,coffee.The rooms were a little on the small side yet very clean. They have a closet,television,hair dryer, coffee maker & complimentary tea & instant coffee in the room.This place is the former "Earls Court Comfort Inn" . I booked this hotel thru "londonnights.com " That's how I received the really good rate.I enjoyed this place would definately stay again.It's at Earls Court just three train stops away from Victoria Station.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroaches - Beware”
Reviews.Author: JAYJAY1948
Reviews.Content: Dreadful - we were greeted by cockroaches in the bath and on the bedroom floor. We also had 3rd floor bedrooms. Shocking. We reported this to reception and their solution was to move us to another room. We said this wasnt acceptable and wanted a refund - we had literally been there 5 minutes. It is now a week later and I am chasing a refund. DO NOT stay - cheap is not also cheerful!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but plenty of wildlife”
Reviews.Author: Guest1976
Reviews.Content: We wanted a cheap but cheerful hotel in central London for a weekend of shopping/theatre and a decent night's sleep. On the plus side it is well positioned in a quiet area close to shops and Earls Court tube station but it had very tired decor and plenty of wildlife. We stayed on the lower ground floor and found cockroaches in our room. We were allocated another room which was again musty smelling, tiny and tired looking. Our complaint re the cockroaches was met with amusement by the reception staff who were clearly aware of the problem although their stories were far from consistent. Depending on who you spoke to the wildlife was blamed on both the garden and drains, and according to one member of staff pest control came in every 3 months but then we were told that pest control came in every month. Worryingly the breakfast room is on the lower ground floor but we were told they are moving it upstairs because of the cockroaches. Eventually our concerns were resolved by head office but even so, we would not recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: S0l0Trekker
Reviews.Content: Thought I should write this review while the experience was fresh in my mind. Looking for a value/budget hotel in London and reading the reviews was quite a daunting and depressing task. However City Continental (CC) is a gem. Location: Unbelievable close to Earl's Court underground, less than 2 mins. This comes in really handy after a long day of trekking across London Direct access by District,Piccadilly lines with excellent connections to Central and circle lines. I never had to wait more than 3 mins even in the rush hours. Security: Really safe area, felt safer than at home : ). Also rooms have a security safe. Breakfast at Hotel: Breakfast is as advertised, however beware its exactly the same menu everyday. I Stayed 7 days, by day 3 I had enough. Accommodation: For once the pics on the website were accurate. I had a single room which was a lot bigger than I expected. Room, bathroom(hot water at really nice pressure) , corridors were always clean, A/c included but you may have to ask the receptionist for the remote. Tv, coffee stand, hair dryer, telephone included........ and how could I forget WIRELESS Broadband. Staff is always helpful once they understand what you are saying and vice versa. Places to eat: Many restaurants and cafes on Earls Court Road Other: Good pharmacies, electronic shops, internet cafes, excess baggage company, laundries/dry cleaners, travel agencies, banks, foreign exchange cambios.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, Shabby Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Light
Reviews.Content: This place typifies the old, rubbish London hotels that we, the poor unsuspecting tourists, end up in: our only crime to want for a reasonably priced room. Windows in my single room were old, old, old - a part of one came loose the last night. Unbearable noise emanated from an adjacent room the final night - I could hear everything & I'm a heavy sleeper! Floors creak constantly, corridors are horribly hot & the bath was slow draining out. It's no bargain here. The place has an air of claustrophobia and decay. I paid Â£65 a night for this privilege. Unfortunately, I was foolish enough prepay the whole 3 night stay. A small amount more would have bought a comfortable, modern double at Premier Inn, Kensington or at Holiday Inn, Kensington Forum. DON'T book this place. Don't encourage this shambolic, overpriced nonsense.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: CatherineN_UK
Reviews.Content: This is not a fancy hotel, but it does the job nicely if you are just looking for a good value clean and simple room in the Earls Court area. Because of its good value I would say it is above average for its class. I was in a twin room with a friend and my only complaint would be that I think it probably used to be a smoking room as it still smelt a bit smokey, but presumably this scent will fade. Breakfast buffet was fine - no complaints. The staff were friendly and helpful. Overall a good choice for good value simple accommodation in a good location (very close to Earls Court tube).

Reviews.Title: “ok but not again”
Reviews.Author: curlyclaire4
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night for the george michael concert. Great location but very poor room, very very small, floor was uneven (I fell) the toilet door was hanging off the hinges and it was very noisey in the hotel. Good point the staff were great! Enjoy...............

Reviews.Title: “Painfully Soft Twin Bed in Singles”
Reviews.Author: ChiWind
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 4 nights May 27, 2008 onward. The new ownership has changed name to City Continental London Kensington and you may get better price going directly to their own website, http://www.citycontinental-kensington.co.uk/. The Good: location very good because of Earls Court Tube Station and Pennywern is a quiet street compared to other hotels in this price range situated on noisy streets such as Cromwell Rd. Sandra at the front desk is very helpful and saved my back by supplying four extra pillows to allow me to elevate my knees in order to relieve the horrendous back pain due to the inadequate and soft mattress! If you do suffer from occasional back problems, I advise against this choice. On arrival I asked why the hotel was so hot, and they advised me I was lucky I did not arrive in summer as it is more difficult to bear. I know some advertise this place as air conditioned, and, of course it is not! It is definitely a HOT house. Windows and doors are left open, and this, of course, is a huge energy waste. Apparently they are unable to temper the hot temps in this building heated by gas? Don't know why. I was situated in the back, so that was another good thing: I woke to birds singing rather than the rattle and rush of traffic. I walked a great deal while staying in this location (I stayed at several other UK locations during 2-week trip) because I needed to walk off the back pain. It is possible to walk to Victoria and Albert along with its neighboring museums: Science Museum and Natural History Museum...all free. There is inexpensive internet cafe upstairs, next to a bakery that sits directly across from Earls Court Road Exit of the Earls Court Tube. (This station has two exits, the other being closer to the Exhibition hall that has Dr Who aplenty at the moment.) As other reviewers have mentioned, it is a fairly fast and convenient Piccadilly Line ride from Heathrow Airport. Half a block away from the hotel is Marks and Spencer providing well priced easy meals. This is obviously very convenient! There are also many fast food options along the Earls Court Road both west and east of that tube exit. No reason to pay hotel 10 pounds for a continental breakfast. From pictures I see if I had been willing to spend more than over $500 for those 4 nights I may have gotten a larger bed, but I do not know if the mattress quality could have been better. Someone else will have to contribute that information. I saw the price per night double after my stay, so I would never recommend paying $200 per night for such a small room and most particularly not during hot summer weather. I will post pictures to give better idea of my room.

Reviews.Title: “OK in Earls Court”
Reviews.Author: Rick099
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located near to Earls Court tube station - giving convenient access from Heathrow. Eating places, launderette and pharmacy are nearby. Staff were friendly and helpful. Room and bathroom were clean and adequate size. We were given "breakfast in a box" because of dining room renovations which was a poor substitute. Even with a lift there were steps everywhere because it's a bit like a rabbit warren. Is just outside the London traffic congestion zone and has no parking.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best choice but still an adequate one”
Reviews.Author: Thalaki
Reviews.Content: (+) Really nice,safe and cute neighbourhood, very very close to Underground station and bus stop A big busy road close to the hotel, where you find shops open even late at night (and by late i mean 11) Friendly staff, cosy hotel Clean room and bathroom (-) The room was very small, but i guess it's small everywhere in London The carpet was filthy, but i guess it's filthy everywhere in London Very strange way to get to your room, i will try to add a video. You had to go to the first floor, and then get down from other stairs and end up to the room that was at the back of the hotel through a strange corridor with many doors. Not a problem but it makes think how you'll be able to get out in case of fire or something :P Kind of poor and crapy breakfast. Only cold stuff, exactly the same for all the seven days we stayed. Two of them we didn't even bother to join even though it was pre-paid and we ate out. The price. We payed about 90 euros per night and it was quite a lot for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: PrairieRover
Reviews.Content: I just completed a 6-day stay at the Comfort Inn Earl's Court, now under a new flag and called the Citi Continental. On the whole I would recommend it, but be aware that there can be communication difficulties with some of the staff, who seem to have English as an additional language, or who have trouble understanding North American accents. Having said that however, I found the staff to be very helpful, even going the extra mile to let me check in early after a very tiring flight. They also took very good care of valuables which I had to leave in the office safe, since the in-room safe wasn't working. I originally booked in for a single/twin room but got a double instead for the same price, thanks to the early check-in. The room was on the third floor and thankfully there is a lift, which isn't always the case with hotels in old terraced houses. The room itself was quite cramped and in serious need of redecorating. I'd have a hard time imagining how 2 people could maneuver in the space, but for a single traveller it was fine. It came equipped with a TV, electronic safe, hair dryer, in-room hot drinks and an in-room air conditioner, which does need to be used. Even though I was there in late March during a cold snap, I did have to run the noisy A/C and/or leave the window open, which can also be noisy since it overlooks the street. I would think seriously about getting a third floor room in the summer! The bathroom was pretty impressive for a room of this size, with lots of elbow room and both a shower & tub. A note about the hair dryer - it is hardwired and placed directly under the fire/heat detector, so the alarms go off every time it's used. I was assured that the problem would be fixed, but saw no evidence of maintenance work on the dryer or the defective safe during my stay. Everything was very clean and well maintained, and the bed was comfortable. A self-serve continental breakfast buffet was included in the price, served in a bright basement level cafeteria. The selection of food was quite good: croissants, toast, choice of cereals, hard boiled eggs, yogurt, cheese, jams, juice, tea and coffee from a dispenser that has a range of drinks like espresso or cafe au lait. The hotel provides both wireless and regular Internet access, for a price. The hotel's street, Penywern Road, is just off Earl's Court Road, and very close to the Earl's Court tube station. This part of Earl's Court is very lively with lots of shops, restaurants & services. Don't miss the Masala Zone if you like Indian cuisine. The food is excellent and they have a budget earlybird menu. Security is good with a card swipe system and a staffed reception desk . If you have the patience to deal with the communication difficulties, I would recommend this place, which overall is something like a decent budget motel in the U.S. or Canada. Location and price are good, as are the general hotel amenities. The rooms themselves could use some work, but maybe with the new ownership, things will improve.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but very shabby”
Reviews.Author: TravellingScotThommo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and although the location is good the hotel was shabby to say the least! The lift wasn't working for the whole of our stay so we had to climb 3 flights of stairs every time. There was a smell of something rotten at the top of the stairs which was there throughout our stay despite telling the reception staff. The room was tiny, there was only enough room for one person to walk round the bed and no more. There was also a damp patch an the ceiling next to the window.

Reviews.Title: “Freezing outside, boiling inside”
Reviews.Author: fancyrats
Reviews.Content: This hotel was reasonably priced and in a good location, and the staff seemed friendly and efficient. We had a room on the third floor. It was very small, and the furniture and fittings matched the size of the room (feet hanging over the edge of the bed!). A small portable TV perched on top of the wardrobe so that the only way to watch it or change channels was to stand on the bed. But what made the stay really uncomfortable was that the temperature of the room was unbearably hot, even though it was freezing outside. We opened the window fully from the moment we got in, turned off the radio, and slept without blankets or a top sheet but still woke at 7 because of the heat that appeared to be coming up through the floor boards.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby”
Reviews.Author: FredaSweden
Reviews.Content: Throughout our 3 night stay, our toilet only flushed once. We had to 'flush'it using the shower. Repeated complaints to the reception staff and the manager got us nowhere. Each morning as we left the hotel, we were told that the problem with the toilet would be sorted out but it never was. The hotel was full so we couldn't move to another room. The manager offered to let us have his room but it was only a single room! The room was like a sauna and overlooked the air conditioning units on the flat roof so we dare not open the window for fear of being robbed. The entire place was run down and very shabby. Our stay there was not an experience that I wish to repeat. The breakfast was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Let_me_advise_you!
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I was comfortable in this hotel. The bed linen was crisp and clean and the bed was comfy to sleep in. (Although it seemed like the floor wasnt cleaned very often!) The room was like a sauna most of the day and I can imagine in the summer time being very very warm in this hotel. It was weird to find in my room that the sink was actually outside the bathroom. The only big problem I found was that I was woken a couple of times in the night by people walking around. The TV reception in the room was good and there were plenty of sky TV channels to watch. Breakfast was lovely too and had a range of food on offer. The hotel is very close to Earls Court underground and some cafe and shops which is great. I would recommend this hotel and would go back to again if I found a cheap deal!

Reviews.Title: “Right at the price”
Reviews.Author: cateCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We looked on trip advisor to find ths hotel, and it was just as i expected. Very clean, small room. Bathroom a god size, though one could smell the mold problem around the window. first floor room, quiet enough except when people went through the fire doors, which were heavy and banged shut loudly. The breakfast was very overpriced at 5 pounds, we mostly ate at local cafes. Some wonderful restaurants and pubs in the area, particularly La Pappardella on Old Brompton Rd., wonderful Italian food! I agree about the blonde clerk, she was unhelpful and dim, but the rest of the clerks were helpful.. The location is wonderful for tube access as well as long walks around Kensinton and Westminster. I would recomend it if you are on a budget and not planning to spend much time in the room

Reviews.Title: “Good location, not a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: CEWEngland
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night as it was close to where I needed to be for an early meeting the next day. The Comfort Inn is in a great location, just round the corner from Earls Court Road and the tube station. However, the hotel itself requires a bit of TLC. My single room was old with flaking paint on the paper thin walls and the bathroom was not as clean as it could have been. I was disturbed several times during the night by other guests walking past my door who were not necessarily being overly loud but it sounded as though they were walking past my bed. Not a great experience and I would not recommend it if you need a comfortable bed and a good night's sleep

Reviews.Title: “awful experience, terrible receptionists”
Reviews.Author: voyage26
Reviews.Content: upon arrival in the "comfort" inn hotel, i was made feel so unwelcome by a blond haired receptionist, she had absolutely no manners or decency and threw my room key at me.i was appalled and i have never received such awful treatment and i have stayed in some substandard accomodation. the luggage room is practically on the street and i would imagine it is not monitored very often. the room was wardrobe size, i booked a double room and when i protested to the receptionist her attitude was take it or leave it. i have to say i have never received such amateurish and shoddy treatment in my life.

Reviews.Title: “No Comfort here!”
Reviews.Author: Roma2007
Reviews.Content: We booked Comfort Inn Earls Court based on all the positive reviews we read on Trip Advisor. However, we were very disappointed. We booked 2 twin rooms at this hotel. As we arrived early, (check in was at 2am), reception told us we could put our luggage in their storage room. We were provided with the key to open the room which was full of suitcases and again, upon our return, we were given the keys to â€œhelp ourselvesâ€�.
